column6: Twitter is great. I like it almost as much as I like Dell.
Where are all the shareholders’ private jets? What happened to CEO accountability? http://t.co/k9Iwev59Bn via @forbes
Happy Birthday to a great nation.
I’ll be on Bloomberg at 4pm today to speak about Dell and “no-brainers.” http://t.co/wH75SDcgc6
I’ll be an Alpha Agitator at tmrw’s Delivering Alpha Conference. Nowadays there are plenty of corporate boards and CEOs to agitate about.
All would be swell at Dell if Michael and the board bid farewell.
Reply to MD's WSJ intv to come. I explain a reason Dell is undervalued is due to a major liability that can be easily removed-Michael Dell.
Of all his scare tactics Dell has finally come up with the best one-he’ll stay as CEO if we don’t accept his offer. http://t.co/cpmcnXfOHy
We are pleased to have won another battle in the Dell war but the war itself is far from over. More to follow.
Yesterday we filed a 21 page brief explaining how we believe the Dell board has breached its fiduciary duties in its recent actions.
We currently have a large position in APPLE. We believe the company to be extremely undervalued. Spoke to Tim Cook today. More to come.
Had a nice conversation with Tim Cook today. Discussed my opinion that a larger buyback should be done now. We plan to speak again shortly.
NYT's thesis that Ackman's actions prove something is wrong with activism is specious. His actions prove only something is wrong with Ackman
Spoke to Tim. Planning dinner in September. Tim believes in buyback and is doing one. What will be discussed is magnitude.
Sunday’s NY Post article, ‘Radioactivists,’ in its 1st sentence states: “This summer, Wall Street’s activist top guns are shooting blanks…”
Our reply: IEP fund is up 19.03% since July 1. While we like the NY Post, what you read in the papers, “ain’t necessarily so.”
We intend to release a letter to all Dell shareholders shortly.
Here is our letter: http://t.co/jHbW6o85A4
Will be on CNBC today at 12:30.
On Bloomberg at 3
As Forest Labs’ 2nd largest shareholder, we have great expectations for FRX due to Brent Saunders becoming CEO.  Press release to come.
Here is our press release re FRX: http://t.co/yVL1WzgTBD
Congrats to @jimcramer – his article outing perpetual losers is a must read! http://t.co/3jcv8ij0bL
A must read for students of “absurdities” – Gretchen Morgenson’s article, P1 Sun @nytimes. Congrats on good reporting http://t.co/hVjsGYrN4n
I will be on @FoxBusiness tonight talking to @TeamCavuto at 8:40 PM ET
I wrote an Op-Ed which I think will be of interest. Now on http://t.co/0ttNxrCwlq website and will be in paper tomorrow.
I'll be on CNBC with Maria Bartiromo at around 4:15 PM ET today.
Our country owes Bernanke a great deal for pulling us out of the mess several of the largest investment banks go us into in ‘08.
Our country has been lucky over its history that it has had the right people to call on in a crisis. It’s sad to see Bernanke go.
IEP announces an acquisition it believes will greatly enhance shareholder value.  See our press release: http://t.co/skk8wRHAdO
The value created for HAIN shareholders over the 3yrs Dave Schechter and Brett Icahn sat on the board is a good example of activism at work
Since they joined the price has increased from $20.20 to $76.27.Irwin Simon stated Dave and Brett’s impact has greatly helped him to succeed
As we say goodbye, we thank Irwin for his great leadership and passion at Hain. Here’s to future dinners with him and his superb products.
Had a cordial dinner with Tim last night. We pushed hard for a 150 billion buyback. We decided to continue dialogue in about three weeks.
I’ll be on CNBC at noon.
I withdrew my demand for appraisal of my Dell shares. Based on our returns on capital, we believe we have better uses for $2 billion.
Disclosed approx 61 million share position in Talisman Energy. May have conversations with mgmt re strategic alternatives, board seats, etc.
Happy to have reached an agreement with Nuance Communications where Dave Schechter and Brett Icahn will join the board of directors.
I'm optimistic their impact at NUAN will be similar to HAIN, where stock went from $20.20 to $79.56 over the 3 years they sat on the board.
Sold block of NFLX today. Wish to thank Reed Hastings, Ted Sarandos, NFLX team, and last but not least Kevin Spacey: http://t.co/BRWpKOBfD2
Just sent a letter to Tim Cook. Full letter will be disclosed on my website, the Shareholders’ Square Table, which will be launched tomorrow
SST has launched.  Join to fight for true corporate democracy, read our letter to Tim Cook, and much more! http://t.co/kAuEwYCpdU
We realize there was a glitch that is now fixed so you can sign in if you were having problems before.
We’ll be talking more about the website and Apple with @ScottWapnerCNBC Wapner at noon on CNBC.
To Bill Gross @PIMCO: If you really want to do good, why not join http://t.co/nn6jp9E2ch like Gates, I and many others have?
I will be on Fox Business today at 1:20 p.m. ET.
I believe that my statement included in today's IEP earnings release will be of interest to all shareholders: http://t.co/IMrcHczmig
Grt news for Transocean and activism today.  RIG will nominate V Intrieri (now on brds of CHK, FRX, NAV) to brd in 2014, giving us 2 seats
RIG also to cut brd to 11, and concluded it will pursue MLP and cut costs/improve margins by $800 mm.  See company press release for details
Encouraging: inst investors realize need for diverse/fresh/truly ind directors. Their vote is where it counts though. http://t.co/fj3glASYJr
Visit http://t.co/kAuEwYCpdU  for my personal views concerning media reports on my remarks re markets and AAPL from Reuters Summit
Disclosed aprx. 34 million share position in HOLOGIC. May have convos re enhancing shareholder value/ brd seats/ etc: http://t.co/RPulrm2sun
Icahn Study shows value of activism; 28% annualized return for investor during our board membership periods.  See http://t.co/aKfWLnnxXU
Happy to have reached an agreement with Talisman Energy where two of our representatives will join the board. http://t.co/LnzaBytXan
The record shows that our involvement on boards has created meaningful value for shareholders. I'm optimistic this will continue with $TLM
Next issue of @TIME Magazine, out tomorrow, features a piece on activism. I understand I will be on the cover. Hope I like what I read.
Gave $AAPL notice we’ll be making a precatory proposal to call for vote to increase buyback program, although not at $150 billion level.
Optimistic re changes at HOLOGIC. Two of our reps have joined the board and we welcome new CEO Steve MacMillan. http://t.co/8gAeFgC0Ao
Also happy that $HOLX has retained Dr. Burton Drayer, Chairman of the Department of Radiology at Mount Sinai, as a scientific advisor.
Wishing all a happy, healthy and prosperous 2014!  ‘13 was a good year for improving corporate governance and I’m hoping ’14 will be great.
Activism proves to be working well at $FRX. Since Sept 10 (when new CEO Brent Saunders arrived) the co’s stock is up aprx 57% and 8% today.
We’ll continue to hold CEOs & boards more accountable & grow partnerships btwn activists & institutional investors to help #ShareholderValue
Oops. Had a typo –$FRX up approx 18% today not 8%
Since tweeting about our large position in $AAPL on Aug 13, when the stock was 468 per share, we’ve kept buying shares of this ‘no brainer.’
Having purchased $500 million more $AAPL shares in the last two weeks, our investment has crossed the $3 billion mark yesterday.
We feel $APPL board is doing great disservice to shareholders by not having markedly increased its buyback. In-depth letter to follow soon.
I'll be speaking with @CGasparino today at 3:10.
Bought another $500mil of $AAPL tday, bringing our total to $3.6 billion.  If board doesn’t see AAPL’s ‘no brainer’ value we sure do.
Today we have put out a seven page letter to $AAPL shareholders discussing why buyback should be markedly increased: http://t.co/O7F8S7BzWg
Just bought $500 mln more $AAPL shares. My buying seems to be going neck-and-neck with Apple's buyback program, but hope they win that race.
Appreciate being featured in @activistinsight Annual Review: http://t.co/c83aNhcDoZ. Review contains great pieces on #shareholderactivism
Cynical @barronsonline piece on $DELL-“Dell's Prospects Suddenly Brighten.” Which Dell was tellng truth when shrhldrs sold @ bargain price?
Tim Cook again confirms $AAPL will launch new products in new categories (plural) this year. Wall Street apparently still not listening.
$GOOG @ 19x2014 est operating profit. At same multiple $AAPL=$1,245 per share. Ridiculous. Keep buying Tim! You still have $145 billion cash
RT @jimcramer: @Carl_C_Icahn -Time to call in to @ScottWapnerCNBC about how much you've been buying of late? Stock has big bid underneath
@jimcramer @ScottWapnerCNBC No need to call Scott. As you noted this morning, Tim came in Clint Eastwood-style and has a lot more bullets.

1/3 The @HBO documentary which I'm the subject of - directed by Bruce David Klein of @AtlasMediaCorp - premieres tonight on @HBOMax at 9PM.

2/3 I’m honored to be of interest to @HBOdocs. A major reason for my participation in the film was that I wanted to convey the following message: There are many good CEOs and boards, but there are far too many terrible ones that are hurting our economy…

3/3 Even though we have great corporations, the boards of these companies don't hold their CEOs accountable, and we are therefore not nearly as productive as we should be, which is a major reason for inflation and the wealth gap.
I’m looking forward to speaking with @erikschatzker on @BloombergTV today at 3pm ET. We’ll be discussing the #IcahnHBO documentary and many more topics.
